result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:52 AM Defendant James M Triggs appeared by zoom video, in custody at Dane County Jail.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for James M Triggs.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed. 
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. 
Clerk's office to set up video appearance from the Dane County Jail for next date.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Zoom confirmation from Dane Co Jail
Request for Zoom placed at Dane Co for waiver of Prelim
Email sent to OTP Notify to cancel, reason: email sent to OTP Notify.  Prelim waiver filed 10/3. Defendant to appear by Zoom from Dane Co Jail.
Letter filed by Atty Wang requesting Zoom. Waiver filed within 48 hours, Zoom granted.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Detainer placed at: Dane County Jail

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with witness A, B & C/First Business Banks, Stone House Development, & Sherwin Williams listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

1:37 PM Defendant James M Triggs appeared by zoom video, in custody at Dane County Jail.  Attorney Steven Hughes for attorney Angela Wang in court for James M Triggs. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marufo. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS. Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Dane County Jail.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Conference Request sent to Dane
